page.title: 08Religion
page.content: Both Walkern & Ardeley have ancient churches: St Mary's & St Lawrence both founded in Saxon times, with Saxon remains in the former. They attract good congregations (40-60) with many more on special occasions & are generally well regarded by non-church goers who see them as focal points of village life & who value the historical continuity & stability which they represent. Walkern has a good & keen choir & both churches have a strong bell-ringing tradition. The tenor bell at St Lawrence was rung to celebrate the victory at Agincourt. A Roman Catholic chapel in Walkern has recently closed. There is an active 'free-church' which has bplayed a part in village life for several hundred years. Though community is largely secular & church goers in a minority, religious life is still important.
